item.title: This Nifty 'Notes' App Is Available to Install as a Snap Package - OMG! Ubuntu!
item.description:
This Nifty 'Notes' App Is Available to Install as a Snap Package - OMG! Ubuntu!

Remember that nifty OS X inspired Notes app we wrote about a few months back? Whether you do or you don't, if you're running Ubuntu 16.04 LTS it's now super easy to install. Notes is now available as a Snap, the new Ubuntu package format installed by default in the latest long-term support release.

item.title: Skylake Pico-ITX SBC has optional I/O boards
item.description:
Skylake Pico-ITX SBC has optional I/O boards

Apr 27, 2016 - by Eric Brown - 0 views Axiomtek's 6th Gen Core "PICO500" Pico-ITX SBC offers extended temperature support, a mini-PCIe slot, and expansion ports with optional I/O cards.

item.title: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS video review
item.description:
Ubuntu 16.04 LTS video review

Ubuntu 16.04 LTS was recently released, and many Linux users have been wondering what it has to offer and if it's worth installing or upgrading from a previous release of Ubuntu. Not to worry, a YouTuber by the name of Quidsup has a full video review of Ubuntu 16.04 that will walk you through the latest changes to Canonical's popular desktop distribution.

item.title: How to maintain a "clean" Ubuntu
item.description:
How to maintain a "clean" Ubuntu

Ubuntu is the most popular GNU/Linux distribution, as it has been the easiest to use for many years now, making it an obvious choice for every newcomer. As most new users don't know if and how they are supposed to maintain they distribution, and since Ubuntu doesn't offer any tools for this job by default, I will provide an overview on the matter through this quick guide.

item.title: Ubuntu Linux and OpenStack cloud come to IBM servers | ZDNet
item.description:
Ubuntu Linux and OpenStack cloud come to IBM servers | ZDNet

AUSTIN, TX -- Last year, IBM introduced LinuxONE, a new pair of IBM mainframes along with Linux and open-source software and services. These new systems are the LinuxONE Emperor, which built on the IBM z13 mainframe and its little brother, Rockhopper. LinuxONE is the heart of IBM's hybrid cloud efforts.

item.title: Open Source and Android: A History of Google's Linux-Based Mobile OS
item.description:
Open Source and Android: A History of Google's Linux-Based Mobile OS

How open is Android, Google's Linux-based mobile operating system? That's a question European regulators are now asking as they level antitrust charges against Alphabet, Google's parent company. To gain some perspective on the issue, a brief history of Android and its role in the open source ecosystem is in order.

item.title: X.Org Members Approve Becoming Part Of The SPI Organization - Phoronix
item.description:
X.Org Members Approve Becoming Part Of The SPI Organization - Phoronix

The results just are in of the 2016 X.Org Foundation elections and the members have voted to become part of the SPI. The foundation thus is basically becoming dissolved to become part of Software in the Public Interest.

item.title: See How Your Linux GPU Compares To Various GeForce GPUs With NVIDIA 364.19 - Phoronix
item.description:
See How Your Linux GPU Compares To Various GeForce GPUs With NVIDIA 364.19 - Phoronix

While waiting for today's release of Tomb Raider on Linux, for which I just posted various NVIDIA Tomb Raider benchmarks on Ubuntu, I was running some other OpenGL benchmarks. One of the benchmark runs I did with various graphics cards this morning while waiting for Tomb Raider was the well known and demanding Unigine Valley demo.

item.title: Tomb Raider Benchmarks On Linux With NVIDIA Graphics - Phoronix
item.description:
Tomb Raider Benchmarks On Linux With NVIDIA Graphics - Phoronix

With Feral Interactive releasing Tomb Raider for Linux, three years after the premiere of the Windows port, many have been wondering about the Linux performance particularly with regards to the graphics driver situation. Here are our initial benchmarks of Feral's port of Tomb Raider on Ubuntu Linux with using NVIDIA graphics.

item.title: ​CoreOS shows OpenStack can be run as a container with Kubernetes | ZDNet
item.description:
​CoreOS shows OpenStack can be run as a container with Kubernetes | ZDNet

AUSTIN, Texas --At the OpenStack Summit, CoreOS CEO Alex Polvi took the risk of running a live demo of OpenStack in a container managed by Kubernetes, Google's container management system. He won his bet. It ran flawlessly before the audience of approximately 7,000 developers.
